job.description:
Defines the name of the job being demanded.
The demanded jobs are placed in the request queue and assigned a unique CA 7 job number.
JOB and JOBL are mutually exclusive
Limits:
1 to 8 alphanumeric characters

jobl.description:
(Optional) Defines the long name of the job being demanded. The demanded jobs are placed in the request queue and assigned a unique CA 7 job number.
JOB and JOBL are mutually exclusive
Limits:
1 to 64 alphanumeric characters

arfset.description:
(Optional)Defines the ARF set name that is used for this run of the job.
you specify **NONE**, no ARF processing is performed for this run of the job
Limits:
1 to 4 alphanumeric characters

cc.description:
(Optional)Defines, with RO (relational operator), the job-level condition codes that are used to determine whether a job executes successfully.
If specified, this value overrides the RO defined for the job in the CA WA CA 7 Edition database.
RO is required when CC is specified
Limits:
1 to 4 numeric characters(0-4095)

class.description:
(Optional)Defines the workload balancing class for resource checking,
Limits:
1 alphanumeric character

count.description:
Defines the maximum number of times to repeat the job. COUNT is ignored if INTERVAL is not specified.
If both COUNT and STOP are specified, the job stops repeating when the COUNT reaches zero or the STOP time is reached, whichever comes first.
Default: None. The job continues repeating until the STOP time is reached
Limits:
1 to 4 numeric characters(0-1439)

date.description:
(Optional)Defines due-out and submit dates.
Limits:
If used, specify DOTM or TIME.
  • +nn
    Defines the number of days after the current date.
    Limits:
    1 to 2 numeric characters from 1 to 99
  • yyddd Defines the Julian date to run the job.

depjob.description:
(Optional)Defines a single predecessor job that must complete while the demanded job is waiting.
Limits:
1 to 8 alphanumeric characters

dotm.description:
(Optional)Defines the due-out time-of-day for the job in hours (hh) and minutes (mm).
If omitted, the current time (when the DEMAND was processed) plus the lead time is assumed.
If DOTM is specified on the DEMAND/DEMANDH command and the value that is given is earlier than the current time, the due-out day is assumed to be the following day.
If DOTM and LEADTM are both omitted, then deadline start time is assumed to be the current time plus the LEADTM.
Default: Current time, hhmm

exec.description:
(Optional)Specifies whether to execute the job (YES/NO).
If NO (N) is used, the job does not run but shows a normal completion as if it did run.
The value that is specified here overrides the value that is coded on the job definition EXEC field.
Default: The job definition panel EXEC value if the job is defined to CA WA CA 7 Edition; otherwise YES,
Values:YES|Y, NO|N

interval.description:
(Optional)Identifies that the job is repeated (executed more than once) and defines the amount of time between each iteration.
If INTERVAL is specified, the TIME and TYPE keywords are required.
If both INTERVAL and COUNT are specified, the INTERVAL value times the COUNT value must total less than 24 hours.
For information about how the deadline, due-out, and submit times are calculated for repeating jobs, see the Usage Notes.
Default: None. The job is not repeated.
Limits:
hh=1 through 2 numeric charact, hhmm

jclid.description:
(Optional)Defines the JCL data set that contains the execution JCL to be submitted.
If used, the value must be a numeric INDEX associated with the wanted JCL data set (on the JCL statement in the initialization file).
If the job is defined in the database, the value must be the same as the value on the DB.1 panel
or the Optional PARMLIB/Parmlib value on the DB.10 and DB.11 panels.
This field or the JCLLIB field is required if the job is not defined in the database.
JCLID and JCLLIB are mutually exclusive.
Note:
Attempts to run cross-platform jobs that are not defined to the database fail because they are treated as regular CPU jobs when processed,

Limits:
1 to 3 numeric characters(1-999)

jcllib.description:
(Optional)Defines the JCL data set that contains the execution JCL to be submitted.
If used, the value must be a symbolic INDEX associated with the wanted JCL data set (on the JCL statement in the initialization file).
If the job is defined in the database, the value must be the same as the value on the DB.1 panel
or the Optional PARMLIB/Parmlib value on the DB.10 and DB.11 panels.
This field or the JCLID field is required if the job is not defined in the database. JCLID and JCLLIB are mutually exclusive.
Note:
Attempts to run cross-platform jobs that are not defined to the database fail because they are treated as regular CPU jobs when processed
1 to 3 numeric characters from 0 through 254 and from 256 through 999. 255 is reserved.

late.description:
(Optional)Specifies whether a notification occurs when the job becomes late.
Specify YES (Y) to make the job eligible to be marked LATE.
If NO (N) is used, the job is never marked LATE.
The value that is specified here overrides the value that is coded on the job definition PROMPTS field,
Values:YES|Y, NO|N

leadtm.description:
(Optional)Defines the amount of elapsed time that is required to process the job.
Indicates in hours (hh) and minutes (mm) the elapsed time.
The maximum value that you can specify is 2400.
Default: 1 hour
Limits:
hh= 1 through 2 numeric characters from 0 to 24
mm= 2 numeric characters from 00 to 59

mainid.description:
(Optional)Specifies the MAINID, as defined in the initialization file CPU statement, to which you want to redirect the job.
The value that is specified here overrides the value that is coded on the job definition MAINID field.
Also, the SASSXX05 user exit does not override this value.
The name must be one of the following values:
  • ALL Specifies all CPUs are acceptable for executing the job.
  • SYn n defines the CPU to which the job is being redirected. The value of n can range from 1 to 7.
    • /SYn n defines a CPU to which the job cannot be submitted. The value of n can range from 1 to 7.
  • -SYn n defines a CPU to which the job cannot be submitted. The value of n can range from 1 to 7.
Limits:
Invalid for internal cross-platform jobs.

prty.description:
(Optional)Defines the initial workload balancing priority,
1-3 numeric (1-255)

rms.description:
(Optional)Specifies whether CA WA CA 7 Edition inserts the CA Workload Automation Restart Option for z/OS Schedulers RMS step.
Specify YES (Y) to insert the step with the CA Workload Automation Restart Option for z/OS Schedulers processing code of P.Enter NO (N) to indicate do not insert of the RMS step.
The value that is specified here overrides the value that is coded on the job definition INSERT-RMS field.
Default: The job definition panel INSERT-RMS value if job defined to CA WA CA 7 Edition; otherwise NO.
Limits:
Invalid for internal cross-platform jobs
, Values: YES|Y, NO|N

ro.description:
(Optional)Specifies the relational operator of the condition code (CC) or
if the step level #SCC statements are being used in the JCL of the job.
If specified, this RO overrides the RO defined for the job in the CA WA CA 7 Edition database.
The following values are valid:
  • EQ
    Equal to
  • LT
    Less than
  • GT
    Greater than
  • GE
    Greater than or equal to
  • LE
    Less than or equal to
  • NE
    Not equal to
  • #S
    Step condition code tests to be made based on a #SCC statement.
  • IG
    No evaluation of the job is done.
    CA WA CA 7 Edition always assumes that the job completes successfully,
    regardless of condition codes, abend codes, or run-time JCL errors.
  • 0
    No condition code test is made.
Default:
The job definition panel RO value if the job is defined to CA WA CA 7 Edition; otherwise 0.
Limits:

Invalid with agent jobs.

schid.description:
Defines the schedule ID within the job's total schedule definition to use for this run.
If omitted, SCHID=1 is assumed unless the job exists in the CA WA CA 7 Edition database and has an associated schedule.
In this case, the first SCHID defined in the schedule member is assumed.
Default: 1,
Limits:
1 to 3 numeric characters from 1 to 999 (See Note)
Note: If the SCHEDULE statement in the initialization file specifies SCHID=YES, this parameter is required.

set.description:
(Optional)Specifies skip the next scheduled cycle for the job (SKP),
disable triggering (NTR), or bypass the database updating at the job completion.
  • SKP
    Specifies this run of the job takes the place of the next scheduled run.
    This value has the same effect as entering NXTCYC,SET=SKP.
    It is reflected on output from LJOB and LLOCK commands as if NXTCYC,SET=SKP was used.
    This parameter is invalid if the job has no schedule.
    SET=SKP has no impact on repeating jobs that are already in the queues.
  • NTR
    Specifies normal triggering is disabled only for this run of the job.
  • NDB
    Allows a job to bypass all load processing at the job completion,
    but allows other processing to proceed typically.
Note: Data set triggering is still in effect.
, SKP|NTR|NDB

stop.description:
(Optional)Defines the clock time after which the job is not repeated.
STOP is ignored if INTERVAL is not specified.
If both COUNT and STOP are specified, the job stops repeating when either the COUNT reaches zero or the STOP time is reached, whichever comes first.
If the STOP time is less than the submit time, the stop date is assumed to be the following day.
Default:
1439 minutes (24 hours minus 1 minute) after the submit time
Limits:

hh=1 through 2 numeric characters from 0 to 23
mm=2 numeric characters from 00 to 59

time.description:
(Optional)Defines a submit time-of-day requirement for the job.
If the format is used with a +, the submit time is calculated from the current time, adding the specified number of hours and minutes.
If the + is used, the DATE keyword must be omitted.
Limits:

+ is optional
hh= 1 through 2 numeric characters from 0 to 23
mm= 2 numeric characters from 00 to 59
Required:

No (unless DATE is used, if so, specify DOTM or TIME (hhmm format). Also required if TYPE=CLOCK is specified.

type.description:
(Optional)TYPE=RES specifies the job is being scheduled in restart/rerun status.
TYPE=CLOCK, START, or END controls how the submit time requirement is calculated for repeating jobs.

When TYPE=RES the job is put into the request queue with a restart requirement.
The job is not submitted before the CA WA CA 7 Edition restart is done.
The output networks are scheduled, but input requirements checking is bypassed.
TYPE=CLOCK, START, or END is ignored if INTERVAL is not specified.
With TYPE=CLOCK, the interval is added to the previous iteration's submit time requirement to determine the new submit time requirement.
With TYPE=START and END the interval is added to the previous iteration's last (most recent) start and end time,
respectively, to determine the new submit time requirement. TYPE is required when INTERVAL is specified.
Limits:

RES, CLOCK, START, or END

If NO (N) is used, the job does not run but shows a normal completion as if it did run.
The value that is specified here overrides the value that is coded on the job definition EXEC field.
Default: The job definition panel EXEC value if the job is defined to CA WA CA 7 Edition; otherwise YES,
Values:YES|Y, NO|N

interval.description:
(Optional)Identifies that the job is repeated (executed more than once) and defines the amount of time between each iteration.
If INTERVAL is specified, the TIME and TYPE keywords are required.
If both INTERVAL and COUNT are specified, the INTERVAL value times the COUNT value must total less than 24 hours.
For information about how the deadline, due-out, and submit times are calculated for repeating jobs, see the Usage Notes.
Default: None. The job is not repeated.
Limits:
hh=1 through 2 numeric charact, hhmm

jclid.description:
(Optional)Defines the JCL data set that contains the execution JCL to be submitted.
If used, the value must be a numeric INDEX associated with the wanted JCL data set (on the JCL statement in the initialization file).
If the job is defined in the database, the value must be the same as the value on the DB.1 panel
or the Optional PARMLIB/Parmlib value on the DB.10 and DB.11 panels.
This field or the JCLLIB field is required if the job is not defined in the database.
JCLID and JCLLIB are mutually exclusive.
Note:
Attempts to run cross-platform jobs that are not defined to the database fail because they are treated as regular CPU jobs when processed,

Limits:
1 to 3 numeric characters(1-999)

jcllib.description:
(Optional)Defines the JCL data set that contains the execution JCL to be submitted.
If used, the value must be a symbolic INDEX associated with the wanted JCL data set (on the JCL statement in the initialization file).
If the job is defined in the database, the value must be the same as the value on the DB.1 panel
or the Optional PARMLIB/Parmlib value on the DB.10 and DB.11 panels.
This field or the JCLID field is required if the job is not defined in the database. JCLID and JCLLIB are mutually exclusive.
Note:
Attempts to run cross-platform jobs that are not defined to the database fail because they are treated as regular CPU jobs when processed
1 to 3 numeric characters from 0 through 254 and from 256 through 999. 255 is reserved.

late.description:
(Optional)Specifies whether a notification occurs when the job becomes late.
Specify YES (Y) to make the job eligible to be marked LATE.
If NO (N) is used, the job is never marked LATE.
The value that is specified here overrides the value that is coded on the job definition PROMPTS field,
Values:YES|Y, NO|N

leadtm.description:
(Optional)Defines the amount of elapsed time that is required to process the job.
Indicates in hours (hh) and minutes (mm) the elapsed time.
The maximum value that you can specify is 2400.
Default: 1 hour
Limits:
hh= 1 through 2 numeric characters from 0 to 24
mm= 2 numeric characters from 00 to 59

mainid.description:
(Optional)Specifies the MAINID, as defined in the initialization file CPU statement, to which you want to redirect the job.
The value that is specified here overrides the value that is coded on the job definition MAINID field.
Also, the SASSXX05 user exit does not override this value.
The name must be one of the following values:
  • ALL Specifies all CPUs are acceptable for executing the job.
  • SYn n defines the CPU to which the job is being redirected. The value of n can range from 1 to 7.
    • /SYn n defines a CPU to which the job cannot be submitted. The value of n can range from 1 to 7.
  • -SYn n defines a CPU to which the job cannot be submitted. The value of n can range from 1 to 7.
Limits:
Invalid for internal cross-platform jobs.

prty.description:
(Optional)Defines the initial workload balancing priority,
1-3 numeric (1-255)

rms.description:
(Optional)Specifies whether CA WA CA 7 Edition inserts the CA Workload Automation Restart Option for z/OS Schedulers RMS step.
Specify YES (Y) to insert the step with the CA Workload Automation Restart Option for z/OS Schedulers processing code of P.Enter NO (N) to indicate do not insert of the RMS step.
The value that is specified here overrides the value that is coded on the job definition INSERT-RMS field.
Default: The job definition panel INSERT-RMS value if job defined to CA WA CA 7 Edition; otherwise NO.
Limits:
Invalid for internal cross-platform jobs
, Values: YES|Y, NO|N

ro.description:
(Optional)Specifies the relational operator of the condition code (CC) or
if the step level #SCC statements are being used in the JCL of the job.
If specified, this RO overrides the RO defined for the job in the CA WA CA 7 Edition database.
The following values are valid:
  • EQ
    Equal to
  • LT
    Less than
  • GT
    Greater than
  • GE
    Greater than or equal to
  • LE
    Less than or equal to
  • NE
    Not equal to
  • #S
    Step condition code tests to be made based on a #SCC statement.
  • IG
    No evaluation of the job is done.
    CA WA CA 7 Edition always assumes that the job completes successfully,
    regardless of condition codes, abend codes, or run-time JCL errors.
  • 0
    No condition code test is made.
Default:
The job definition panel RO value if the job is defined to CA WA CA 7 Edition; otherwise 0.
Limits:

Invalid with agent jobs.

schid.description:
Defines the schedule ID within the job's total schedule definition to use for this run.
If omitted, SCHID=1 is assumed unless the job exists in the CA WA CA 7 Edition database and has an associated schedule.
In this case, the first SCHID defined in the schedule member is assumed.
Default: 1,
Limits:
1 to 3 numeric characters from 1 to 999 (See Note)
Note: If the SCHEDULE statement in the initialization file specifies SCHID=YES, this parameter is required.

set.description:
(Optional)Specifies skip the next scheduled cycle for the job (SKP),
disable triggering (NTR), or bypass the database updating at the job completion.
  • SKP
    Specifies this run of the job takes the place of the next scheduled run.
    This value has the same effect as entering NXTCYC,SET=SKP.
    It is reflected on output from LJOB and LLOCK commands as if NXTCYC,SET=SKP was used.
    This parameter is invalid if the job has no schedule.
    SET=SKP has no impact on repeating jobs that are already in the queues.
  • NTR
    Specifies normal triggering is disabled only for this run of the job.
  • NDB
    Allows a job to bypass all load processing at the job completion,
    but allows other processing to proceed typically.
Note: Data set triggering is still in effect.
, SKP|NTR|NDB

stop.description:
(Optional)Defines the clock time after which the job is not repeated.
STOP is ignored if INTERVAL is not specified.
If both COUNT and STOP are specified, the job stops repeating when either the COUNT reaches zero or the STOP time is reached, whichever comes first.
If the STOP time is less than the submit time, the stop date is assumed to be the following day.
Default:
1439 minutes (24 hours minus 1 minute) after the submit time
Limits:

hh=1 through 2 numeric characters from 0 to 23
mm=2 numeric characters from 00 to 59

time.description:
(Optional)Defines a submit time-of-day requirement for the job.
If the format is used with a +, the submit time is calculated from the current time, adding the specified number of hours and minutes.
If the + is used, the DATE keyword must be omitted.
Limits:

+ is optional
hh= 1 through 2 numeric characters from 0 to 23
mm= 2 numeric characters from 00 to 59
Required:

No (unless DATE is used, if so, specify DOTM or TIME (hhmm format). Also required if TYPE=CLOCK is specified.

type.description:
(Optional)TYPE=RES specifies the job is being scheduled in restart/rerun status.
TYPE=CLOCK, START, or END controls how the submit time requirement is calculated for repeating jobs.

When TYPE=RES the job is put into the request queue with a restart requirement.
The job is not submitted before the CA WA CA 7 Edition restart is done.
The output networks are scheduled, but input requirements checking is bypassed.
TYPE=CLOCK, START, or END is ignored if INTERVAL is not specified.
With TYPE=CLOCK, the interval is added to the previous iteration's submit time requirement to determine the new submit time requirement.
With TYPE=START and END the interval is added to the previous iteration's last (most recent) start and end time,
respectively, to determine the new submit time requirement. TYPE is required when INTERVAL is specified.
Limits:

RES, CLOCK, START, or END

ca7#.description: Indicates the individual job to cancel, and the value must be a CA 7 job number.</br>

force.description:
(Optional) Specifies to force the cancellation of the job.
If you want to cancel the job to dump the log data set, specify FORCE=YES to prevent the job from being resubmitted.
Use FORCE=YES when a job to be canceled shows a status of SKELETON or RETRY.
Use FORCE=YES to cancel a job with connected resources.
Warning! Use of this option can potentially cause CA WA CA 7 Edition to abend; therefore, only use it as a last resort.

reason.description:
(Optional) Defines the reason for the job cancellation.
Depending on the initialization file CANCEL statement value, this reason can be required or optional.
If it is required but not given, a message prompts the user to provide it.
The text is entered into the run log entry for this occurrence of this job and is displayed on any subsequent LRLOG inquiries.
Limits:
1 to 40 alphanumeric characters
Required:
No (depending on initialization options)

ca7messages.description: CA 7 Response to the ADDRQ command

transaction-key.description: The request identifier used in the request if any.

status.description: The http status of the request

ca7-configuration-name.description: The name of CA 7 instance where the command was sent

transaction-key.description: The request identifier used in the request if any.

ErrorADDRQResponse.description: CA 7 Rest Api Request Error Response

ca7#.description:
Defines the job to which you want to add the job requirement.
The job must be in the request queue.
  • jobnumber
    Defines the CA 7 job number to which you want to add the requirement for this run of the job.
    Limits:
    1 to 4 numeric characters

depjob.description:
Defines a temporary one-time job dependency requirement.
The DEPJOB value specifies the job name that must complete execution or must be manually posted complete before the job identified by JOB is eligible for submission.
DEPJOB is required unless USR is used, in which case, omit DEPJOB.
This requirement is satisfied automatically when the predecessor job completes.
Only in unusual situations would this requirement must be satisfied manually. That is, any time that a normal completion did not occur.
Required: Yes, unless USR is used.
Limits:
1 to 8 alphanumeric characters

usr.description:
Defines the description of a temporary, one-time user requirement..
This requirement must be manually satisfied before the job identified by JOB is eligible for submission.
If any commas are included as part of the text, enclose the entire requirements text in parentheses.
This requirement is satisfied automatically when the predecessor job completes.
Only in unusual situations would this requirement must be satisfied manually. That is, any time that a normal completion did not occur.
Required: USR is required unless DEPJOB is used, in which case, omit USR.
Limits:
1 to 36 alphanumeric characters

rmtjob.description: (Optional) Names the job in the remote scheduler that is required by the job specified in the JOB field.</br><b style = "font-family:georgia,garamond,serif;font-style:bold;">Limits:</br>RMTJOB should accept up to 64 characters; valid characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period (.), underscore (_), hyphen (-), colon (:), and pound (#); do not include embedded spaces or tabs.

rmtschd.description: (Optional) Names the remote scheduler where the predecessor job runs.</br>Before adding this requirement, the remote scheduler must be defined.</br>The remote scheduler defined as type LOCAL cannot be specified.</br><b style = "font-family:georgia,garamond,serif;font-style:bold;">Limits:</br>1 to 3 alphanumeric characters; generic specification not supported.

filenames.description: Log file names. Wildcards are not allowed.

GetLogFilesRequest.description: Specifies an optional list of file names to retrieve

name.description: The unique name of this instance.</br>This is the name to be used in all API requests</br>.

ca7_secure.description: True, if the communication with CA 7 should use secure sockets.

ca7_keystore.description: The full path to the keystore/truststore file used for SSL communication to CA7ONL

ca7_protocol.description: The SSL protocol to be used for secure socket communication with CA7ONL.</br>The default is TLSv1.2.</br>If it is not specified the default will be used.

ca7_communicatorPoolSize.description: The maximum number of connections to be opened to a CA7ONL instance.</br>This must be a positive value that does not exceed the maximum number of terminals.</br>

ca7_communicatorEvictableIdleTimeSeconds.description: The time, in seconds, to keep an existing connection open.</br>If the connection is not used and the idle time passes, the connection will be closed.</br>

ca7_authorizationRetryCount.description: The number of retries to be used for access to endpoint authorization.</br>If HttpStatus.SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE is returned, the authorization will be retried up to ca7_authorizationRetryCount.</br>The default is 5.

ca7_timeout.description: The timeout, in seconds, used when connecting to and reading from CA 7 via the TCP/IP terminal interface.</br>The default is 60.

db_logical_name.description: The logical database name</br>If not specified in the instance configuration, the name will need to be passed as a parameter to the request.

db_host.description: The Datacom server host IP/DNS</br>If not specified in the instance configuration, all the requests that requires Datacom connection will fail

db_port.description: The Datacom server port</br>If not specified in the instance configuration, all the requests that requires Datacom connection will fail

db_user.description: The Datacom user ID</br>If not specified in the instance configuration, all the requests that requires Datacom connection will fail

db_server_name.description: The Datacom server name</br>If not specified in the instance configuration, all the requests that requires Datacom connection will fail

db_secure.description: Flag to be set to true if the connection to db will be done using SSL</br>The default is false

db_trustStore.description: The full path to the keystore/truststore file used for SSL communication to Datacom

db_protocol.description: The SSL protocol to be used for secure socket communication with Datacom.</br>The default is TLSv1.2.</br>If it is not specified, the default will be used.

db_max_pool.description: The maximum number of Datacom connections to be available in the same time.</br>Default: 10

db_min_pool.description: The minimum number of Datacom connections to be kept idle when they are not used</br>Default: 0

db_timeout.description: The connection to Datacom timeout in seconds</br>Default: 60

db_trace.description: Flag to turn on/off the jdbc trace on the RestApi side for Datacom queries</br>Default: false

Identifies how the job was brought into the queue.
The possible values are:

    Indicates a triggered job.
  • DEMD
    Indicates a demanded job.
  • EXTL
    Indicates a job that is submitted external to CA WA CA 7 Edition
  • PS
    Indicates a job that the Personal Scheduling System submitted.
  • RPET
    Indicates a repeated job.
  • RUN/br> Indicates a job that is brought in by the RUN command.
  • SSCN
    Indicates a job that is brought in by schedule scan.
  • XDEM
    Indicates a job brought in by the DEMAND command from an XPS client.

Note: If ARF detects an exception condition for the job,
the last character of this field has an asterisk as in the following example: DEM*

index.description: The index value for the schedule id

schedule-modification-overlaid.description: An indication of whether a schedule modification (SCHDMOD) has been overlaid by a subsequent RESOLV command (Y/N)

schedule-modification-current.description: An indication of whether a schedule modification (SCHDMOD) has been made to this schedule (Y/N)

calendar-id.description: Contains the override of the default SCAL for this SCHID. The CC portion of the SCALyycc calendar

repeat-type.description:
For repeat scheduling, the type of repeat job. This field determines how the submit time requirement is calculated for repeating jobs.
Valid values are:
  • C = CLOCK
  • S = START
  • E = END

repeat-interval.description: For repeat scheduling, the interval between repetitions of the job (in DDDHHMMSSNNNNNN format)

repeat-count.description: For repeat scheduling, the number of times the job should be repeated

repeat-stop-time.description: For repeat scheduling, the time after which the job should not be repeated (in 0HHMMSS format)

sequence-timestamp.description: Can be used to sequence the schedule ids into the order in which they were created. This date/time stamp does not indicate when the schedule id was created, but only the order in which they were created

description.description:
The description of this type of schedule element.
Valid values are:
  • ANNUAL
  • DAILY
  • MONTHLY
  • SYMMETRIC
  • WEEKLY

do-not-run-on-days.description: An indication of whether rday or day indicates days not to run (Y/N)

uses-relative-days.description: An indication of whether scheduling is using relative days of the month (Y/N)

uses-days.description: An indication of whether scheduling is using specific days of the annual schedule (Y/N)

sunday.description: An indication of whether weekly scheduling on Sunday was specified (Y/N)

monday.description: An indication of whether weekly scheduling on Monday was specified (Y/N)

tuesday.description: An indication of whether weekly scheduling on Tuesday was specified (Y/N)

wednesday.description: An indication of whether weekly scheduling on Wednesday was specified (Y/N)

thursday.description: An indication of whether weekly scheduling on Thursday was specified (Y/N)

friday.description: An indication of whether weekly scheduling on Friday was specified (Y/N)

saturday.description: An indication of whether weekly scheduling on Saturday was specified (Y/N)

january.description: An indication of whether monthly scheduling in January was specified (Y/N)

february.description: An indication of whether monthly scheduling in February was specified (Y/N)

march.description: An indication of whether monthly scheduling in March was specified (Y/N)

april.description: An indication of whether monthly scheduling in April was specified (Y/N)

may.description: An indication of whether monthly scheduling in May was specified (Y/N)

june.description: An indication of whether monthly scheduling in June was specified (Y/N)

july.description: An indication of whether monthly scheduling in July was specified (Y/N)

august.description: An indication of whether monthly scheduling in August was specified (Y/N)

september.description: An indication of whether monthly scheduling in September was specified (Y/N)

october.description: An indication of whether monthly scheduling in October was specified (Y/N)

november.description: An indication of whether monthly scheduling in November was specified (Y/N)

december.description: An indication of whether monthly scheduling in December was specified (Y/N)

day-number-is-negative.description: An indication of whether the day/relative day shown in day-number is negative (Y/N)

week-number-is-negative.description: An indication of whether the week shown in week-number is negative (Y/N)

day-number.description: The day or relative day number

symmetric-start.description: The Julian day of the year on which the symmetric schedule is to begin for symmetric scheduling

symmetric-span.description: The number of days between scheduled processing cycles for symmetric scheduling

CA7JobSchedule.description: The list of schedules for the scheduled job

job.description: The scheduled job name

default-schedule-calendar-id.description: The default schedule calendar ID of the scheduled job

schedule-lock.description:
An indication whether the schedule has been updated and needs to be resolved (Y/N).
Valid values are:
  • Y - The schedule has been updated and needs to be resolved
  • N - The schedule is resolved

last-schedule-resolve-time.description: The date and time when the job's schedule was last resolved (in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format)

job-schedule-count.description: The number of schedules for the scheduled job

job-schedules.description: The list of schedules for the scheduled job

scheduled-job-count.description: The number of scheduled jobs that match the selection criteria

job.description: The name of the job

resource-count.description: The number of resources for the job

resources.description: The list of resources for the job

CA7JobResourceJob.description: The list of jobs that match the selection criteria

job-count.description: The number of jobs that match the selection criteria

jobs.description: The list of jobs that match the selection criteria

resource.description: The name of the virtual resource connected to this job

schid.description: The schedule ID associated with this resource

resource-count.description: For count resources, the quantity of the resource required by this job

internal-user-id.description: The CA 7 internal user security designation

step-name.description: Step name after which the resource is released

type.description:
The type of virtual resource.
Valid values are:
  • A = address space
  • C = resource count
  • Q = co-requisite
  • S = shared access
  • X = exclusive access

free.description:
The FREE option controlling when the virtual resource is released from the job.
For type S (shared access) and X (exclusive access):
Valid values are:
  • A = Free if any step abends
  • F = Free when any job ends, either successfully or unsuccessfully
  • N = Do not free the resource at a successful job completion. The resource can be freed with the PRSCF command
  • Y = Free at a successful job completion
For type Q (co-requisite):
Valid values are:
  • A = Submitted if the resource is active
  • I = Submitted if the resource is inactive
For type A (address space):
Valid values are:
  • A = Submitted only if the resource is active on the same system as CA Workload Automation CA 7 Edition
  • I = Submitted if the resource is inactive on the same system as CA Workload Automation CA 7 Edition
For type C (resource count):
Valid values are:
  • A = Decrement the resource count when the job abends
  • F = Decrement the resource count when the job completes, either successfully or unsuccessfully
  • N = Do not decrement when the job completes
  • Y = Decrement when the job or step ends successfully

Ca7JobResource.description: The list of resources for the job

job-count.description: The number of jobs that match the selection criteria

jobs.description: The list of jobs that match the selection criteria

job.description: The z/OS job name

long-name.description: An alias name for this job.  This name may be used by scheduling engines on other platforms,such as AutoSys.

job-type.description: The type of the job, one of CPU, XPJOB or AGENT

agent-job-type.description: The type of the agent job

system.description: The user-defined application system associated with this job

owner.description: The ID identifying ownership of this job

jobnet.description: The name of CPU job network of which this job is a part

last-update-user.description: Userid that last updated the prose element

arfset.description: The collection of ARF definitions that apply to this job

lterm.description: The logical terminal name to which messages about this job should be routed.

mainid.description: A number.If positive, the CPU number on which the job may execute.  If negative, the CPU number on which the job may not execute.

uid.description: The CA 7 internal user security designation

prior-run-ca7#.description: The CA 7 job number for the last execution of this job

job-region.description: Amount of storage (in kilobytes) requested for this job

workload-balancing-priority.description: CA 7 Workload Balancing priority assigned to this job.

condition-code.description: Return code value used to determine if the job succeeded or failed

number-runs.description: Number of times this job has been executed

number-late.description: Number of times this job has been marked late.

number-restart.description: Number of times this job has been restarted.

average-cpu-time.description: Average CPU time per execution of this job.Format is DDD HH MM SS.NNNNNN

number-1-tape-man.description: Number of type 1 tape drives required by this job. This number is manually entered

number-1-tape-calc.description: Number of type 1 tape drives used by this job, as indicated by LOAD or analyze

number-2-tape-man.description: Number of type 2 tape drives required by this job. This number is manually entered

number-2-tape-calc.description: Number of type 2 tape drives used by this job, as indicated by LOAD or analyze

prose-number.description: Number of the prose text associated with this job, or zero

jcl-library.description: Either an ampersand (&) followed by the name of the JCL library, or a three digit number of the JCL library

last-update-time.description: The date and time of the last update to the job definition.

end-time.description: The date and time of the last completion of the job.

start-time.description: The date and time when the job last started.

sched-last-resolved-time.description: The date and time when the job's schedule was last resolved

elapsed-time.description: The average amount of time for the job to complete, stored as DDD HH MM SS NNNNNN.

schedule-before-time.description: The don't schedule before date and time for the job.

schedule-expiration-date.description: Schedule Expiration Date. Used to determine if SCHDMOD OVERLAID status should be reset after a RESOLV is done.

job-requirement-lead-time.description: Job requirement lead time, in format DDD HH MM SS.NNNNNN.

dataset-requirement-lead-time.description: Dataset requirement lead time, in format DDD HH MM SS.NNNNNN

timezone-offset.description: If TZONE_EXISTS is set to Y, then this field contains the HHMM (+/-) time zone offset

timezone-exists.description: Y if TZONE_OFFSET contains a time zone offset, or N if not.

message-class.description: The job's MSGCLASS, informational only, no validation performed.

relational-operator.description: Relational operator to be used with COND_CODE to determine if the job has successfully completed or not.</br>Valid values are:</br>0, 00, or IG - no test;</br>GT - greater than; GE - greater than or equal;</br> EQ - equal; LT - less than; LE - Less than or equal;</br>NE - not equal;</br>#S - use #SCC cards in job's JCL

last-maintenance-type.description: The type of the last maintenance done to this job.</br>Valid values are: A - ANALYZE;</br>L - LOAD; M - database maintenance;</br>S - SMF updates

job-lock.description: Y if job is locked, N if not

job-restart.description: Y if job can be restarted, N if not

next-cycle-off.description: Y if scheduling for this job has been turned off, N if not

next-cycle-skip.description: Y if scheduling for the next cycle of this job should be skipped, N if not

start-time-set.description: 'Y' indicates a start date/time has been set for the last time job ran to successful completion.

job-scheduled.description: Y if job is scheduled, N if not

ca11-job.description: If 'Y', the RESTART keyword was set to 'Y' in the batch job definition. RESTART is an alias of INSRTRMS.

has-triggers.description: Y if the job triggers other objects, N if not.

job-override.description: Y if the job marked for override, N if not.

non-executable.description: Y if job marked non-executable, N if job is executable.

job-verify.description: Y if job marked for verification, N if not.

insert-ca11-rms.description: Y if the CA 11 Run Management Step (RMS) should be inserted, N if not.

hold.description: Y if job is held on entry to the queues, N if not.

ignore-requirements.description: Y if job ignores requirements, N if not.

jcl-prior-run-queue.description: Y if the job's JCL is retained in the prior run queue, N if not.

job-jcl-in-override-library.description: Y if the job's JCL is in the override library, N if not.

load-status.description: Y if the job is load status, N if not

schedule-lock.description: 'Y' indicates schedule has been updated and RESOLV is needed.

need-load.description: Y if the job needs to be loaded, N if not.</br>Set to 'Y' job is first added to CA 7 database.

need-reload.description: Set to 'Y' if RELOAD=Y, or if SASSSM5C invoked,else is 'N'

no-load.description: Set to 'Y' if RELOAD=X, else set to 'N'

ca7touni-job.description: Y if job is a CA7TOUNI job, N if not.

xpsi-job.description: Y if the job is an XPSI job, N if not.

xpsi-no-prmlib.description: If 'N' there is no XPJOB PARMLIB member.</br>If 'Y' a PARMLIB member and library specified in the job definition.

xpsi-no-prmdef.description: If 'N', there is no XPJOB XP PARM data.</br>If 'Y'there is data in the XPJOB XP PARM field.

xpsi-su-type.description: Type of 'switch user' command to execute.</br>  'Y'executes SU including .PROFILE.</br> 'N' just executes SU.

print-requirements.description: Y if the job's requirements are printed in the browse log on entry to the queues, N if not.

issue-prompts.description: Y if prompts are issued if the job is late, N if not.

suppress-error-requirements.description: If 'Y', list error messages for job requirements not used.</br>If 'N', suppress messages for job requirements not used.

suppress-error-dsn-requirements.description: If 'Y', then list error messages for DSNs used at.</br> execution but not found in the CA 7 database.</br>If 'N' suppress errors.

xpsi-node.description: Primary XPSI node for this job.

xpsi-param.description: PARM1 value from the DB.10 screen.

agent-name.description: The name of the agent where this job will execute.

agent-user.description: The userid with which this agent job will execute.

executable.description: Y if job marked as executable, N if not.

schedule-after-time.description: The don't schedule after date and time for the job.

job.description:
Specifies the job name on which the indicated function is performed.
Limits: 1 to 8 alphanumeric characters

schid.description:
(Optional) Specifies the schedule ID (of this job) for which a user requirement is applied. A zero default cannot be specified for one connection and a nonzero schedule ID used for a subsequent connection to the same job with the same user requirement description. An attempt to make such a connection results in an error message.
Default: 0, which indicates that the requirement holds for all schedule IDs
Limits: 1 to 3 numeric characters from 0 through 999

job-name.description:
Specifies the job name on which the indicated function is performed.
Limits: 1 to 8 alphanumeric characters

resource-name.description:
Specifies the resource name being connected to the job.
Limits: 1 to 44 characters, the first character must be nonblank, and no embedded blanks
Exception: If the resource connection is made to a resource count resource,
the resource name can be from 1 to 39 characters followed by a / (slash) and
a 1 through 4 numeric value indicating the number of occurrences for the resource that the job uses.

schid.description:
(Optional) Specifies the schedule ID (of this job) for which a user requirement is applied.
A zero default cannot be specified for one connection and a nonzero schedule ID used for
a subsequent connection to the same job with the same user requirement description.
An attempt to make such a connection results in an error message that is issued.
Default: 0, which indicates that the requirement holds for all schedule IDs
Limits: 1 to 3 numeric characters from 0 through 999

job.description: The name of the job that requires the predecessor

schid.description: The schedule id of requiring job

nextrun.description: The status of predecessor for next run of job

predobject.description: The predecessor. Values vary with predtype.</br>When “predtype”:”JOB”, “predobject” is 1-8 character name of required job.</br>When “predtype”:”DSN”,”predobject” is 1-44 name of required dataset.</br>When “predtype”:”USER” then “predobject” is 1-44 character user requirement text.

leadtime.description: The satisfaction lead time in hours.</br>This may be honored when “predtype” is “job or “DSN”

permanent.description: Indicates that this predecessor is permanent, that is always considered satisfied.</br>This parameter only applies when “predtype” is “DSN”.

CommandJobDeleteResponse.description: CA 7 Rest Api Delete Job Definition Request Response

message.example: o be able to delete a job, you need to specify both the job name and delete type. The delete type must be one of DELETE, DD or PURGE

status.description: The http status of the request

ca7-configuration-name.description: The name of CA 7 instance where the command was sent

CommandJobDeleteError.description: CA 7 Rest Api Request Error Response

job.description: The name of the job

type.description:
The type of deletion.
Valid values are:
  • DELETE
    Deletes a job and its associated data from the database (documentation, schedules, and so forth).
  • DD
    Same as DELETE, but deletes any data sets that this job references if the data sets have no users and
    no documentation, and do not cause job triggering.
    This includes all virtual resources that are connected to the job.
  • PURGE
    Same as DD, but also deletes job trigger definitions that trigger the job being deleted,
    job requirement definitions that require the job being deleted;
    and, if the WA Restart Option interface is active, deletes the WA Restart Option
    CMT member for the job being deleted.

dataset-name.description:
(Required if dataset-number is omitted) Specifies the data set name whose creation/update causes triggering of a job.
Note: For VSAM files, specify the cluster name.
Limits: 1 to 44 alphanumeric characters

dataset-number.description:
(Required if dataset-name is omitted) Specifies the existing data set number whose creation causes triggering. The number is the value that CA 7 assigned to the data set.
Limits: 1 to 8 numeric characters

schid.description:
(Optional) Specifies for which schedule ID of the triggering dataset the triggered-job is scheduled.
Note: If the data set is one that is tracked with use of SASSXDSN (externally tracked data sets), the schid field must be 000 for the trigger to work
Default: 0 (all schedule IDs)
Limits: 1 to 3 numeric characters from 0 through 999

triggered-job.description:
Specifies the job name that the completion of the triggering dataset triggers.
Limits: 1 to 8 alphanumeric characters

CommandDatasetDeleteError.description: CA 7 Rest Api Request Error Response

dataset-name.description:
(Required if dataset-number is omitted) Specifies the data set and must be the fully qualified data set name.
Limits: 1 to 44 alphanumeric characters
Note: dataset-name is not required to conform to MVS data set name standards. Embedded blanks and special characters such as slashes, dashes, and underscores are permitted. All alphabetic characters are uppercased.

dataset-number.description:
(Required if dataset-name is omitted) Specifies the data set to use. The value must be the numeric value that CA 7 already assigned.
Limits: 1 to 8 numeric characters
